urn:uuid:a94372ec-89a0-4280-8ce8-b1fc430.title: Flicker from Within: Circuit Arbor Expanded

data.usageInfo: For academic use in a digital curation exhibit on cultural computing
data.keywords: cultural computing, circuit board, glowing tree, photorealism, ethereal ambient light, digital roots, golden particles, hybrid interface, memory in code
data.description: In this photorealistic rendering, luminous trees sprout from the etched copper pathways of a circuit board, their roots and branches glowing with warm light. The organic tendrils spill over a wooden surface, symbolizing the spread of cultural memory through technological soil. The image evokes life, expansion, and the flickering persistence of culture blooming from code and circuitry. AI-generated with prompt: 'A digital photograph depicts a striking fusion of technology and nature, as glowing tree-like structures emerge from the electronic components of a circuit board. These luminous trees, with their branching tendrils glowing golden, intertwine with the copper pathways and extend into real, gnarled roots spilling over a worn wooden surface, all bathed in warm atmospheric light against a softly blurred backdrop of glowing, golden bokeh.'
